title: Where was this picture taken from?
content:
[img]http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/Image:Gnosticus_IV.png[/img]

I can't recall seeing this picture of Gnosticus IV in any of the offical games. Perhaps it was taken from Keen GBC? Whoever uploaded it to the KeenWiki, was under the user account "Img87" there.------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: well...
content: Based on its size/stretch, I'd guess it's from the Keen4 end sequence, when the Oracle presents the "You are here // They are here" map.

title: Re: Where was this picture taken from?
content:
At least my version (by Apogee Software, shareware, v1.4) doesn't have this picture. Those "you are here" and "they are here" indicators are on a picture of the whole Galaxy, and the only planet depicted (later) is Korath III.------------------------------

title: Re: Where was this picture taken from?
content: Hmm... I can't find it, either. Maybe its from some fanmade thing (a mod, or something?)-Genius314

title: Re: Where was this picture taken from?
content:
I was looking at that page and got to wondering about it. I'm almost sure I'd never seen a picture of Gnosticus IV before, and I'm not sure if this is an official picture or not.

It sort of reminds me of the image of Korath III in the Keen 4 ending sequence. But I don't think it actually appeared there.

It's a mystery to me.

[img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: Where was this picture taken from?
content:
Ah, so it's from a fan game. It looks nice, the picture.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Where was this picture taken from?
content:
If you couldn't tell, that was just a joke. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img]
But it's more likely taken from a fan-game, as I can't recall seeing it in any mods, nor Gnosticus IV mentioned in any of them.

Unless, of course, it was taken from Keen GBC. Can any owner of the GBC game confirm this theory?------------------------------

title: Re: Where was this picture taken from?
content:
I don't think it's from GBC, the palette and style are too different.

And hah, I didn't realize you were joking. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] I just quickly checked the link and saw the picture there and thought absolutely nothing. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Where was this picture taken from?
content:
I'm being serious here. It looks EXTREMELY familiar. I know I've seen it somewhere before. I'm thinking it might even be on my computer somewhere.-----------------------------------

title: Re: Where was this picture taken from?
content:

Awww! Feel the love!
